verses.text: 問安基督耶穌的僕人保羅，蒙召作使徒，奉派傳　神的福音。

words.note: Often used in opening of letters.
In biblical context, often refers to a bondservant.
Reverent space before character for God.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 這福音是　神藉著眾先知在聖經上預先所應許的，

words.note: Indicates a plural or collective noun.
Used as a locative suffix here.
Transforms a verb phrase into a noun phrase.
Forms a descriptive or possessive phrase.

verses.text: 就是論到他的兒子我們的主耶穌基督：按肉身說，他是從大衛的後裔生的；

words.note: In this context, refers to Jesus as Lord.
Refers to physical human nature.
Part of a fixed phrase '...說' (speaking from the perspective of...).
Used to form a descriptive clause.

verses.text: 按聖潔的靈說，因為從死人中復活，顯明他是大有能力的、　神的兒子（「顯明他是大有能力的、　神的兒子」或譯：「以大能顯明他是　神的兒子」）。

words.note: In this context, refers to the Holy Spirit.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'among'.
Lit. 'greatly possessing power'.
A concise way to say 'great power'.

verses.text: 我們從他領受了恩典和使徒的職分，在萬族中使人因他的名相信而順服，

words.note: Used as a locative suffix meaning 'among'.

verses.text: 其中也有你們這蒙耶穌基督所召的人。

words.note: Functions as a demonstrative pronoun, modifying '人' (these people).
Often used in passive constructions in biblical Chinese, meaning 'to be granted/receive'.
Indicates the preceding phrase is the agent of the following verb in a passive structure.
Forms a noun phrase '蒙...所召的人' (people who were called by...).

verses.text: 我寫信給各位住在羅馬，為　神所愛，蒙召為聖徒的人。願恩惠平安從我們的父　神和主耶穌基督臨到你們。

words.note: Used to address a group respectfully.
Indicates the agent in a passive construction, similar to 'by'.
Used as a proper noun for the Christian God.
Indicates the preceding phrase is the agent of the following verb in a passive structure.
A compound meaning 'to receive a calling' or 'be called'.
Functions as a linking verb, indicating status or role.
Lit. 'holy follower/disciple'.
Expresses a wish or desire.
A key theological term for divine favor.
Common greeting and biblical blessing, often referring to spiritual peace.
Refers to God the Father in a theological context.
Used as a proper noun for the Christian God.
Refers to Jesus Christ as Lord.
Often used for spiritual blessings or events 'coming upon' someone.

verses.text: 保羅渴想到羅馬去首先，我靠著耶穌基督，為你們大家感謝我的　神，因為你們的信心傳遍天下。

words.note: Emphasizes a strong, deep longing or yearning.
Indicates direction away from the speaker/subject.
Expresses dependence or means.
Commonly used to refer to 'everybody present' or 'all of you'.
Used as a proper noun for the Christian God.
A core theological concept.
Traditional Chinese term for 'the world'.

verses.text: 我在傳揚他兒子福音的事上，用心靈事奉的　神，可以作證我是怎樣不斷地記念你們，

words.note: Indicates the sphere or context of an action.
Often used for spreading a message or doctrine.
Lit. 'blessed news'.
Suffix indicating 'in the aspect of' or 'concerning'.
Refers to the spiritual essence of a person or God.
Specific term for serving God or a superior.
Modifies '神' (the God whom I serve with my spirit).
Used as a proper noun for the Christian God.
Lit. 'not breakingly', adverbial form of '不斷'.
In biblical context, often means 'to remember with affection and purpose'.

verses.text: 常常在禱告中懇切祈求，也許我可以照著他的旨意，終於能夠順利地到你們那裡去。

words.note: A verb-object compound that functions as a noun, meaning 'to pray' or 'prayer'.
Suffix indicating 'in the midst of' or 'during'.
Describes an earnest or sincere manner.
Emphasizes seeking something through prayer or supplication.
Often refers to God's will or divine purpose.
Adverbial form of '順利' (smooth, successful).
Indicates direction away from the speaker/subject.

verses.text: 因為我很想見你們，好把一些屬靈的恩賜分給你們，使你們可以堅定；

words.note: Used to prepose the object of a verb.
Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'.
Lit. 'grace bestowed' or 'gift of grace'.

verses.text: 也使我在你們中間，藉著你我彼此的信心，大家一同得到安慰。

words.note: Lit. 'trusting heart'.

verses.text: 弟兄們，我不願意你們不知道，我好幾次預先定好了要到你們那裡去，為了要在你們中間也得一些果子，像在其他的民族中間一樣，可是直到現在還有阻礙。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers.
Can refer to spiritual fruit in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 無論是希臘人或是未開化的人，聰明的人或是愚笨的人，我都欠他們的債。
所以，對我來說，我隨時都願意把福音也傳給你們在羅馬的人。

words.note: Idiomatic expression indicating a personal perspective.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 福音是　神的大能我不以福音為恥；這福音是　神的大能，要救所有相信的，先是猶太人，後是希臘人。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'
Special character used in Chinese Bibles for 'God'
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb or adjective

verses.text: 神的義就是藉著這福音顯明出來，本於信而歸於信，正如經上所記：「義人必因信得生。」

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or agent of an action

verses.text: 人類不尊　神為　神　神的震怒，從天上向所有不虔不義的人顯露出來，就是向那些以不義壓制真理的人顯露出來。
神的事情，人所能知道的，在他們裡面原是明顯的，因為　神已經向他們顯明了。
其實自從創世以來，　神那看不見的事，就如他永恆的大能和神性，都是看得見的，就是從他所造的萬物中可以領悟，叫人沒有辦法推諉。
因為他們雖然知道　神，卻不尊他為　神，也不感謝他，反而心思變為虛妄，愚頑的心就迷糊了。

words.note: The raised character indicates reverence for God.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
Implies emptiness and lack of truth/purpose.
Common in older texts and biblical translations.

verses.text: 他們自以為是聰明的，卻成了愚蠢的。

words.note: Literally 'oneself takes as right'.

verses.text: 他們用必朽壞的人、飛禽、走獸和昆蟲的形象，取代了永不朽壞的　神的榮耀。

words.note: Refers to physical decay or moral corruption.
More formal or literary, common in biblical lists of creatures.
More formal or literary, common in biblical lists of creatures.
Refers to being free from physical decay or moral corruption.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
A key theological concept in Christianity.

verses.text: 人類種種的罪惡因此，　神就任憑他們順著心中的私慾去作污穢的事，以致羞辱自己的身體。

words.note: A fundamental concept in Christian theology.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
Implies allowing someone to do as they wish, often with negative consequences.
Refers to desires contrary to God's will.
Indicates direction or purpose, 'go to do'.
Refers to ritual impurity or moral defilement.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

verses.text: 他們用虛謊取代了　神的真理，敬拜事奉受造之物，卻不敬拜事奉造物的主。他是永遠可稱頌的，阿們。

words.note: Refers to untruth or deceit.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.
A fundamental theological concept.
Often paired with '敬拜' (jìngbài) to describe religious devotion.
Literally 'things that receive creation'.
Often paired with '敬拜' (jìngbài) to describe religious devotion.
Literally 'Lord of created things'.
A Hebrew word meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.

verses.text: 因此，　神就任憑他們放縱可恥的情慾：他們的女人把原來的性的功能，變成違反自然的功能；

words.note: Refers to the divine being, God.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for sinful desires.

verses.text: 同樣地，男人也捨棄了女人原來的性功能，彼此慾火攻心，男人與男人作出可恥的事。他們這樣妄為，就在自己身上受到應該受的報應。

words.note: Describes being overcome by lust, common in biblical descriptions of sin.
Refers to consequence for one's actions, often divine.

verses.text: 他們既然故意不認識　神，　神就任憑他們存著敗壞的心，去作那些不正當的事。

words.note: Refers to the divine being, God.
Refers to the divine being, God.
Often refers to moral corruption in biblical texts.
Indicates purpose or direction to act.
不正當 (búzhèngdāng) means 'improper'.

verses.text: 這些人充滿了各樣的不義、邪惡、貪心、陰險；滿懷嫉妒、兇殺、好鬥、欺詐、幸災樂禍；又是好說讒言的、

words.note: A core concept of sin in Christian theology.
A fundamental concept of sin in Christian theology.
Listed as a sin in many biblical passages.
Often listed among the vices in the Bible.
One of the Ten Commandments forbids murder.
A common form of sin condemned in the Bible.
Idiom for taking pleasure in others' misfortunes.
Condemned as a sin in many biblical passages.

verses.text: 毀謗人的、憎恨　神的、凌辱人的、傲慢的、自誇的、製造惡事的、忤逆父母的、

words.note: Similar to 讒言, a form of harmful speech.
Often connected with bitterness and anger in the Bible.
Refers to the divine being, God.
Actions that degrade or dishonor others.
Pride is frequently portrayed as a dangerous sin in the Bible.
Often associated with arrogance and lack of humility.
Refers to morally wrong actions.
Disobedience to parents is condemned in the Bible.

verses.text: 冥頑不靈的、不守信用的、冷酷無情的、沒有惻隱之心的。

words.note: Lit. 'darkly stubborn, not keen-witted'
Lit. 'not keep trustworthiness'
Lit. 'cold and cruel, without feeling'
Lit. 'heart of pity and sympathy'

verses.text: 他們雖然明明知道行這些事的人，　神判定他們是該死的，然而他們不單自己去行，也喜歡別人去行。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes clarity.
Refers to the Christian God.
